definition: to be keen on/to have a passion for
to love/to be fond of/to like/affection/to be inclined (to do sth)/to tend to (happen)

sentences.english: I like ice cream and cookies as much as the next guy.
sentences.chinese: 和其他人一样我也酷爱冰激凌和小点心。

sentences.english: The Egyptian queen Cleopatra loved purple.
sentences.chinese: 埃及女王克娄巴特拉酷爱紫色。

sentences.english: Before accepting regular professional oil painting training, Qin Zanjun was keen on traditional Chinese painting when he was a child.
sentences.chinese: 秦赞军在接受科班油画训练之前，自幼酷爱国画。

sentences.english: Yale is actually really big on smiling.
sentences.chinese: 耶鲁的确是酷爱微笑的学校。

sentences.english: Those who are overweight or indulge in high-salt diets are candidates for hypertension.
sentences.chinese: 体重超标或酷爱高盐饮食的人很可能患高血压。

sentences.english: Adventurous Annie grows up to become a navy fighter pilot.
sentences.chinese: 酷爱冒险的她长大后成为了一名海军战斗机飞行员。

sentences.english: My son, Douglas, loves to play with toy guns.
sentences.chinese: 儿子道格拉斯酷爱玩具枪。

sentences.english: My mother likes baking so there'd be lots of cakes and mugs of tea.
sentences.chinese: 我的母亲酷爱培烘，所以会有各种各样的糕点和茶饮。

sentences.english: I have always been fascinated by corsets and my husband, Duncan, is frightfully keen on restraint.
sentences.chinese: 我和我的丈夫邓肯都为束衣着迷，酷爱拘束。

sentences.english: Without reasons, I have ever loved pure colour, especially white dress.
sentences.chinese: 不知何故，自幼便酷爱净色，尤爱纯白色的服装。

sentences.english: He lived a poor life in his childhood and developed interests in reading, calligraphy and seal cutting .
sentences.chinese: 他幼年时生活清苦，酷爱读书，喜欢书法篆刻。

sentences.english: I love peppermint ice cream too.
Little Yuge has been fond of reading from a young age; she began reading from books with colorful pictures.
sentences.chinese: 小宇歌从小酷爱读书，最早是从彩色画儿书开始的。

sentences.english: I was very keen on Latin and French poetry.
sentences.chinese: 我酷爱拉丁文和法文的诗歌。

sentences.english: They love to eat fresh peach.

definition: to like/to take pleasure in/keen on/fond of/interest/hobby/appetite for/CL:個|个[ge4]
to treasure/to be very fond of
to have a special fondness (for sth)
to like/to love/to be fond of/favorite
to become excited with/to be enchanted by
to be infatuated with/to be enchanted by/to be passionate about
to be partial towards sth/to favor/to prefer/preference/favorite
to fall in love/to love sb or sth dearly (lover, or art)
